## How to enable the system to automatically publish the "Pass" course grade?

John is the course manager in an organisation. A course with capacity of 1000
learners has been assigned to him and he is responsible for publishing final
course grades to learners. John wants the "Pass" course grades to be
automatically published to learners when they have completed their reference
material tasks and passed their quizzes contributing to the final course
grade. Let’s see how John will enable the system to automatically publish the
"Pass" grades to learners.

1\. In Curricula, John clicks **Course** on the left navigation pane, and
finds his course.

2\. John clicks the **Configure** button and navigate to **Configure
settings**.

3\. He turns on the **Automatically mark the course grade** toggle and selects
the **Automatically publish the "Pass" course grade** checkbox. The "Pass"
grade will be automatically published to learners when they have completed all
compulsory tasks or one optional task if there are no compulsory tasks.

Note the following:

• When John adds a learning object to a course, he can configure the
**Compulsory or optional** option to decide whether the task grade will be
used as the reference for the final course grade marking, either in automatic
marking or manual marking.

• If John only wants the course grade to be automatically marked and he wants
to manually publish the course grade to learners, he needs to deselect the
**Automatically publish the "Pass" course grade** checkbox.
